content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::Union{Date,DateTime}, bump::Integer=1800)
    if isa(dt, DateTime)
        new_dt = dt + Hour(bump)
    else
        error("timezone_bumper function only works with DateTime types.")
    end
    return new_dt
end
```

Note that I added a default value for the `bump` argument (1800 seconds, which is 3 hours in minutes) to make the code more user-friendly.
